title: Drug-Receptor Interactions
author: ayobami
description: examining the pharmacokinetics of how drugs target receptors to mediate their effects

questions.question: Binding of agonists causes the equilibrium to shift from active(R*) to inactive(R) form to produce a biologic effect
Binding of antagonists causes the equilibrium to shift from inactive(R) to active(R*) form to produce a biologic effect
Binding of agonists causes the equilibrium to shift from inactive (R*) to active(R) form to produce a biologic effect
Binding of antagonists to a receptor stabilize the active (R*) form
Binding of antagonists to a receptor stabilize the inactive (R*) form
Binding of antagonists to a receptor stabilize the inactive (R) form
The ùõÉ-adrenegic receptor uses cAMP as its second-messanger
The ùõÇ1-adrenegic receptor uses phosphatinositides as its second messangers
The GABA A- receptor uses cAMP as its second-messanger
The GABA A- is a ligand-gated channel that increases chloride influx, resulting in depolarization of neurons, and more chance of generating an action potential
The GABA A- is a ligand-gated channel that increases chloride influx, resulting in hyperpolarization of neurons, and less chance of generating an action potential
A system in which only a fraction of the total receptors have to be occupied to produce a maximal response is said to have spare receptors
The ùõÉ-adrenoceptors in the heart have a large functional reserve because they have 5-10% of spare receptors

In drug tolerance, repeated exposure of a receptor to an agonist, results in upregulation of receptors
In drug tolerance, repeated exposure of a receptor to an antagonist, results in upregulation of receptors
